alert.note: Alert for Central Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARION AND WEST CENTRAL PUTNAM COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Orange Springs, or 9 miles northeast of Fort McCoy, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Interlachen, Orange Springs, Hog Valley, Johnson, and Mannville. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
